text: Arnaldo Casella Tamburini in 1917 Count Arnaldo Casella Tamburini, Jr. (January 24, 1885 - September 12, 1936) was an Italian artist who took his own life in Chicago, Illinois. ==Biography== He was born in Florence, Italy on January 24, 1885 to Arnaldo Casella Tamburini, Sr. He took his own life on September 12, 1936 in Chicago, Illinois when he jumped from a second story window at St. Luke's Hospital where he had been hospitalized for mental illness. ==References== Category:1885 births Category:1936 deaths Category:20th-century Italian painters Category:Italian male painters Category:Suicides by defenestration Category:Suicides by jumping in the United States Category:Suicides in Illinois Category:19th-century male artists
title: Arnaldo Casella Tamburini
